result.execSummary:
The defendant Crystal Gondek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court grants 2 days credit time served
Court allows transfer of probation to Washington County
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample. Court ordered the defendant to pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision. Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment. 
- Restitution set at $0.00.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, she may never own or possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that she may not vote until her civil rights have been restored.

- No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs.
- No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
- No new law violations arising to the level of probable cause.
- NO CONTACT with any Home Depot in Milwaukee County and NO CONTACT with co-actor A.M.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

- AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety.
- Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Crystal Gondek

records.addlTxt:
Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court withheld the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 2 YEARS, CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.  Court grants 2 days credit time served. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety.
- Random urine screens and breathalyzers.
- Provide DNA sample.
- No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs.
- No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. 
- Maintain employment. 
- No new law violations arising to the level of probable cause. 
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department. 
- NO CONTACT with any Home Depot in Milwaukee County and NO CONTACT with co-actor A.M. 

*Court allows transfer of probation to Washington County. 

Court set restitution at $0.00.  Court ordered the defendant to pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision.  Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment. 

20 day appeal rights given.

Defendant Crystal Gondek in court.  Attorney Robert J Hampton III in court for Crystal Gondek.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a plea and sentencing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.  Defendant sworn. 

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, she may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that she may not vote until her civil rights have been restored.  

Sentencing proceeded.

Defendant Crystal Gondek appeared by video.  Attorney Robert J Hampton III appeared by video for Crystal Gondek.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference. Defense requests plea and sentencing date. State does not object. Case remains calendared in Branch 02.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Case recalled.
Defendant Crystal Gondek in court.  Attorney Ashley Fard in court for Crystal Gondek on behalf of Attorney Robert J Hampton III.  Attorney James Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin.

Defendant appears in court.  Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Court scheduled a status conference on September 6, 2022 at 8:30 AM in Branch 2, Rm 608 CH.

Defendant Crystal Gondek not in court.  Attorney Robert J Hampton III in court for Crystal Gondek.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a plea and sentencing. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued with REMAND TO JUDGE upon return of the bench warrant. Court took no action on bail.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Crystal Gondek in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
OFF THE RECORD. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 room G55 CJF.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Crystal Gondek in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with any Home Depot location in Milwaukee County.

Defendant Crystal Gondek in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Kathryn Ginsberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.   Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/21/22 @ 2p
